oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Dining Room at the Matt Gardner Homestead
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: West, Carroll Van, photographer
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Finding Community
Towns, Neighborhoods
African Americans -- Dwellings; Dining rooms
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A plank table with six ladder back chairs sits in front of a double hung window in a room with unpainted wooden walls and wood floor. The table is set with blue and white china and a glass oil lamp.

The Matt Gardner Homestead interprets African American history as well as agricultural history. The dining room, pictured here, shows some of the items that a prosperous farmer such as Matt Gardner would have owned. Matt Gardner was so successful that he was able to make loans to other farmers, both African American and white.
